name: Joyce's Fantastic Lemon Easter Bread
author: Leslie Ann Owen
summary: This recipe was developed by my good friend, Joyce. It was written for a bread machine, but I'm sure it could be adapted. Light bread with a wonderful lemon flavor! Try toasted...Yum!
ingredients: ¾ cup warm water (100 degrees F/38 degrees C)
2 tablespoons warm water (100 degrees F/38 degrees C)
directions: Pour both amounts of warm water into a bread machine and add butter, eggs, lemon extract, bread flour, sugar, and yeast in the order recommended by the manufacturer
Select dough setting and start the machine
Remove dough when cycle is finished; cut dough into 3 equal-sized pieces
Roll each piece into a ball and place into a prepared cake pan; cover and let rise for 1 hour
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake loaves in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 15 to 20 minutes
